README.html.title: WorldLib | WorldLib
README.html.summary: WorldLib A simple wrapper to all that is worldbox. This allows you to mess with core systems without inside-out knowledge of the entire worldbox codebase. Installation Download BepInEx to the game folder and start the game once. Then you will see a Bepinex/plugins folder in your game files. Put the DLL file in there and restart the game. You have now installed WorldLib!

Methods AgeFromSlot(int) Returns the WorldAge associated with a given slot index. public WorldAge AgeFromSlot(int slot) Parameters slot int The zero-based slot index. Returns WorldAge The WorldAge in that slot. SetAge(int) Sets the active age to a specific slot. public void SetAge(int slotIndex) Parameters slotIndex int The zero-based slot index to activate. SetAge(WorldAge, bool) Sets the active WorldAge. public void SetAge(WorldAge age, bool doSlotFinding = true) Parameters age WorldAge The WorldAge that should become the active age. doSlotFinding bool Whether to attempt locating and synchronizing a matching slot for the age. Remarks When doSlotFinding is enabled, the system attempts to locate an existing slot associated with the requested age. If a matching slot is found, it becomes the active slot. If no slot is found, the current slot is updated to represent the requested age. Disabling slot finding skips this synchronization step, which may result in inconsistent or unexpected slot state. It is recommended to never turn slot finding off. SetAgeToSlot(WorldAge, int) Assigns a specific WorldAge to a given slot index. public void SetAgeToSlot(WorldAge age, int slotIndex) Parameters age WorldAge The WorldAge to assign to the slot. slotIndex int The zero-based index of the slot to set the age for. Remarks This method directly sets the age for the specified slot without changing the currently active age (unless you modify the slot that is active). Use this when you want to rearrange or predefine age slots. SetDefaults() Refreshes the active age slots in accordance with age rules. public void SetDefaults() Remarks Uses DefaultSlots and LinkDefaultSlots to build a new set of ages in the slots. SetSpeedMultiplier(float) Adjusts the speed multiplier for age progression. public void SetSpeedMultiplier(float speedMultiplier) Parameters speedMultiplier float SlotFromAge(WorldAge) Returns the slot index for a given WorldAge, if it exists. public int? SlotFromAge(WorldAge age) Parameters age WorldAge The WorldAge to search for. Returns int? The zero-based slot index, or null if no slot contains the age. StartNextAge(float) Immediately starts the next scheduled age, optionally at a custom progress point. public void StartNextAge(float startProgress = 0) Parameters startProgress float The progress at which to start the age (0.0 = beginning, 1.0 = complete). TogglePaused(bool) Pauses or unpauses age progression. public void TogglePaused(bool shouldPause) Parameters shouldPause bool true to pause, false to resume.

api/WorldLib.Utils.AbstractionOf-1.html.summary: Class AbstractionOf<TStore> Namespace WorldLib.Utils Assembly WorldLib.dll Provides a lightweight abstraction layer over an underlying store instance, exposing controlled access to the wrapped object. public abstract class AbstractionOf<TStore> Type Parameters TStore The type of the underlying object being abstracted. Inheritance object AbstractionOf<TStore> Derived WorldAge WorldAges SimObject WorldHistory WorldHistoryEntry WorldLaws WorldStatusAsset Inherited Members object.ToString() object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() Remarks The underlying store is resolved through a delegate and is recomputed on every access to Base. This allows the abstraction to reflect dynamic or externally replaced instances instead of capturing a fixed reference.
